types.name: Query
types.description: The query root of Rakuten Ichiba's GraphQL interface.

args.name: sid
args.description: Service id

args.name: sort
args.description:
Display order.
(1: from cheapest item, 2: from expensive item, 5: recent history, 6: older history, 7: from lowest affiliate rate item,
8: from highest affiliate rate item, 9 from lowest review count item, 10: from highest review count item,
51: order by recent history, 61: order by old history, 52: order by recent history, 62: order by old history)

args.name: pageIndex
args.description: Output page number of this API's response.

args.name: genreId
args.description: Genre ID to filter the result.

args.name: browsingDate
args.description: Browsing time.(This parameter is effective only if 'sort' is 51,52,61 and 62)

args.name: itemType
args.description:
Target item category.(0: all items, 1: available items, 2: group purchase item, 3: rakuten auction item
4: gift items, 5: request for information material, 6: rakuten books)

args.name: itemNameTruncate
args.description: Maximum length of item name. Item name which exceeds specific value are replaced by "...".

args.name: first
args.description: This argument will return the first n values of the response

args.name: offset
args.description: From offset to offset+limit values will be returned.(If the limit isnt specified then it will be offset+5)

args.name: limit
args.description: This argument will be used with the offset.

args.name: period
args.description: default 0

args.name: first
args.description: default daily

args.name: shopId
args.description: ID of Shop whose review information is going to be fetched.

args.name: itemId
args.description: ID of Item whose review information is going to be fetched.

args.name: page
args.description: Page count of this API's response. page must be between 1 and 100.

args.name: hits
args.description: Response item count by page. hits must be between 0 and 30.

args.name: buyFlag
args.description: Specifies if user bought item or not.(0: all item, 1: User bought item)

args.name: maxEvaluation
args.description: User's maximum evaluation. maxEvaluation must be bigger than minEevaluation.

args.name: minEevaluation
args.description: User's minimum evaluation. minEevaluation must be smaller than maxEvaluation.

args.name: maxAge
args.description: User's maximum age. maxAge must be bigger than minAge.

args.name: minAge
args.description: User's minimum age. minAge must be smaller than maxAge.

args.name: sex
args.description: User's gender.(0: male, 1: female)

args.name: imageFlag
args.description: Specifies if a review has image or not.(0: Review don't have image, 1: Review has image)

args.name: ageLimitFlag
args.description: This flag is not used in logic, so it does not have any impact for the response.(Valid value: 0,1)

args.name: sort
args.description:
Sort order.
(-regtime: Order with new registration time, -evaluation: Order with high evaluation, -judgment: Order with high judgment score)

args.name: userRank
args.description: Default Current Date, Format: yyyy-MM-dd-HH-mm-ss

args.name: shopId
args.description: Unique Identifier of a Shop whose information is going to be fetched

args.name: itemId
args.description: Unique Identifier of an Item whose information is going to be fetched

args.name: shopUrl
args.description: Unique url of a Shop whose information is going to be fetched

args.name: manageNumber
args.description: This argument is Currently disabled.

args.name: scPgId
args.description: Unique Identifier of Source Page, it's required to get Coupon Acquisition data

args.name: vId
args.description: Hash token, it's required to get Coupon Acquisition data

args.name: scClId
args.description: Hash of Campaign_id and Logic_Id, it's required to get Coupon Acquisition data

args.name: scMcId
args.description: Unique Identifier of Merchant Campaign, it's required to get Coupon Acquisition data

args.name: sid
args.description: This argument is required to get Coupon Acquisition data

args.name: itemId
args.description: Default viewType

args.name: deviceType
args.description: issued by PPMT tool by CWD

args.name: channelType
args.description: default pc

args.name: templateName
args.description: default pc

args.name: first
args.description: tracking code for Landing URL

args.name: userRank
args.description: Date format: yyyy-MM-DD-HH-mm-ss

types.name: BrowsingHistory
types.description: BrowsingHistory Schema: Provides user's browsing history list. (easyId will be provided by APICatalogue layer).

fields.name: reviewAverage
fields.description: Average Rating based on users review

fields.name: reviewCount
fields.description: Number of reviews for the item

fields.name: url
fields.description: Merchant top page URL OR exhibitor's page URL

fields.name: deleteUrl
fields.description: URL which is used for deleting this history data

fields.name: historyDate
fields.description: The date on which this history data was recorded

fields.name: item
fields.description: Please note that Using connection will make additional calls to Itemserver api to fetch data

fields.name: shop
fields.description: Please note that Using connection will make additional calls to shopbiz api to fetch data

args.name: sid
args.description: Service id

args.name: shopId
args.description: Shop Id of Browsing page.(A half-width number Less than 6 figures)

args.name: itemId
args.description: Item Id of Browsing page.(A half-width number Less than 10 figures)

args.name: itemType
args.description: Item Type.(0: Usually Item, 1: SA, 2: GBUY, 3: PRESENT)

args.name: genreId
args.description: Genre Id of Browsing page.(6 figures of half-width numbers)

args.name: sid
args.description: Service id

args.name: historyType
args.description:
History type.(1: item, history2: search, keyword, history3: merchant, history4: product,
history5: genre, history14: item & product history)

args.name: itemHistory
args.description:
A key of deleting history.(Item history : service_id:item_id:shop_id:shopUrl,
Search keyword history: Hashed history value by MD5,Merchant history: service_id:shopId,Product history: service_id:RanCd)

types.name: EventDate
types.description: EventDate: Provides event's date

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Introspection defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: 'A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: 'If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given __Type is

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: An enum describing valid locations where a directive can be placed

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on queries.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on mutations.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fields.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment definitions.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on fragment spreads.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on inline fragments.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a schema IDL definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a scalar IDL definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an object IDL definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field IDL definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on a field argument IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an interface IDL definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an union IDL definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an enum IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object IDL definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Indicates the directive is valid on an input object field IDL definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if`'argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.
